entry.title: 0x02-tips/vim.txt
entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
A simple vim configuration to made these type of files better to edit.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Vim Configs - 0x03 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Vim Configs ]]-------------------------------------------------------
Put these in your `.vimrc`:
``` set tw=80 set colorcolumn=80 hi ColorColumn ctermbg=darkgrey guibg=darkgrey ```
---[[ 0x03 Signature ]]---------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: priv_example.txt
entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
This is just a hdden post example.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Hidden Post - 0x03 Reference - 0x04 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Hidden Post ]]-------------------------------------------------------
This post isn't listed in public index:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/index.txt
But in hidden index:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/priv.txt
---[[ 0x03 Reference ]]---------------------------------------------------------
More info here:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/0x01-features/hidden-posts.txt

entry.title: 0x01-features/hidden-posts.txt
entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
I know there are texts you don't want to be made public, me too. Because of that, *Make TXT Site* provide this feature.
I will explain how to use hidden posts feature in *Make TXT Site*.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Hidden Posts Feature - 0x03 Example - 0x04 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Hidden Posts Feature ]]----------------------------------------------
First of all you must have configured some variables in `Makefile`, as discussed in `/0x00-starting.txt`, they are:
- `HIDDEN_INDEX` - `HIDDEN_PATTERN`
These variables are used to create the hidden posts lists and exclude hidden posts from normal public index.
For example if you `HIDDEN_PATTERN` is `priv_` so create posts following that pattern in posts directory and they will be treated as hidden posts:
- public/priv_example.txt - public/priv_secret.txt
These posts will not be listed in normal public index but in hidden index as well.
---[[ 0x03 Example ]]-----------------------------------------------------------
This is a hidden post:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/priv_example.txt
And it isn't listed in public index:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/index.txt
But in hidden index:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/priv.txt
---[[ 0x04 Signature ]]---------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: 0x02-tips/gitlab-pages.txt
entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
Sites made by *Make TXT Site* are simple to be hosted. Gitlab pages is a great way to do that.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Gitlab Pages - 0x03 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Gitlab Pages ]]------------------------------------------------------
All you need is to create a `.gitlab-ci.yml` file in root directory. A example content to this file:
``` image: alpine:latest
pages: stage: deploy script: - echo 'Nothing to do...' artifacts: paths: - public only: - master ```
Maybe you have to change somethings in these file, for example `public` and `master` to correspond your posts directory and branch but it isn't likely.
> If your repository is private perhaps you want the pages be public accessible > anyway. Go to 'Settings > General > Visibility > Pages' and set to 'Everyone'.
---[[ 0x03 Signature ]]---------------------------------------------------------
-----BEGIN PGP MESSAGE-----

entry.title: 0x01-features/gpg.txt
entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
This topic explain how *Make TXT Site* use GPG improving user security.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Signing - 0x03 Verify - 0x04 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Signing ]]-----------------------------------------------------------
As *Make TXT Site* works with txt files it's to sign a post file.
To use this feature you need to have a key configured in your keyring GPG file.
After create and edit your post you can run `make sign `.
This command will generate a sign to that file and append it to the same file. This way it's a standalone file and its signature.
> You can sign index.txt files as well.
---[[ 0x03 Verify ]]------------------------------------------------------------
After signing a post/file your users can verify that file to improve integrity.
To do so, there is a simple command:
``` curl -s $POST_URL | gpg --verify ```
For example:
``` $ curl -s 'https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/index.txt' | gpg --verify gpg: Signature made Fri 01 May 2020 06:35:27 PM -03 gpg: using RSA key 51954F0B84A661554DDBBE0805709A504810CE93 [...] ```
> Cropped text aren't important.
